name: Rahima Foundation
mission: Today, the world celebrates vast technological advancements, yet every 9th person suffers from food scarcity (1). The rate of food insecurity in the United States is even higher, standing at 11.8% (2). In the Silicon Valley, specifically, that rate more than doubles to 24.8%—making every 4th person food insecure (3). A total of 720,000 people out of 2.9 million Bay Area residents live with food insecurity (3).
theoryOfChange: Rahima Foundation states it provides a safety net to low-income community members through monthly groceries, rent and utility assistance, hot meals, and educational support to address basic needs and food insecurity.
zakatClaimEvidence: Found 'donate zakat' on https://www.rahima.org/zakat-rahima (https://www.rahima.org/zakat-rahima); Website mission/programs mention zakat (Source: https://www.rahima.org/donate)

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 31/50, the charity shows high donor fit for those prioritizing domestic poverty and Zakat-eligible causes [3]. The organization also encourages community engagement through structured volunteer opportunities [4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates strong financial health with a total revenue of $4,006,022 and a program expense ratio of 95.3% [1][2]. While the direct service model is effective for domestic poverty relief, the impact score of 29/50 reflects a relatively high cost per beneficiary of 14222.072 [1].

baseline_narrative.summary: Based in California, Rahima International Foundation focuses on alleviating hunger and financial insecurity through direct service programs including soup kitchens and meat collection [1][2]. The organization is recognized as Zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill religious obligations through various giving methods [3].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The foundation earns a high Charity Navigator score of 96.0/100 due to its excellent financial health and transparency, though its overall impact score is moderated by a high cost per beneficiary.

Prioritize charities with exceptional financial efficiency

strengths.detail: The organization directs all of its funding to its mission, maintaining a <cite id="[2]">95.3% program expense ratio</cite> and spending <cite id="[1]">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>.
The charity has earned a <cite id="[1]">96/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and holds a Gold Seal of Transparency from Candid.
The organization provides critical local relief by accepting <cite id="[3]">Zakat and Sadaqa</cite> to fund food distribution in the Bay Area.

strengths_deep_dive: Rahima International Foundation stands out for its remarkable financial metrics. By maintaining a <cite id="[2]">95.3% program expense ratio</cite>, the organization ensures that donor contributions are maximized for direct beneficiary impact. This efficiency is further highlighted by its fundraising costs, which sit at an impressive <cite id="[1]">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>. The charity's commitment to accountability is reflected in its <cite id="[1]">96/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: Founded in <cite id="[4]">1993</cite>, Rahima International Foundation is a California-based humanitarian organization dedicated to alleviating hunger and financial insecurity in the San Francisco Bay Area. The organization delivers direct services through food distribution, soup kitchens, and meat collection programs. In 2023, the charity reported <cite id="[2]">$4,006,022 in total revenue</cite> and demonstrated exceptional financial efficiency with a <cite id="[2]">95.3% program expense ratio</cite>. The organization is highly rated by independent evaluators, maintaining a <cite id="[1]">96/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and holding a Gold Seal of Transparency from Candid. Furthermore, the charity operates with remarkable fundraising efficiency, spending <cite id="[1]">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>. Donors can fulfill their religious obligations as the organization accepts <cite id="[3]">Zakat and Sadaqa</cite> for its domestic poverty alleviation initiatives.
